intro: Monogynella vahliana, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, emitting a strong, sweet scent to attract nocturnal pollinators. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often with a slightly hairy texture. Monogynella vahliana is typically found in grasslands and savannas, thriving in well-drained soils.
